intro: Phyllanthus lathyroides var. oblongatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with lanceolate or oblong leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color, and it is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is known for its medicinal uses in traditional medicine, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
